item.title: Sean Cairncross Confirmed by Senate as National Cyber Director
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The US Senate voted to confirm Sean Cairncross as the National Cyber Director, five months after nominalization.

The post Sean Cairncross Confirmed by Senate as National Cyber Director appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 44 Deals Announced in July 2025
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Forty-four cybersecurity merger and acquisition (M&A) deals were announced in July 2025.

The post Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 44 Deals Announced in July 2025 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Northwest Radiologists Data Breach Impacts 350,000 Washingtonians
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Northwest Radiologists says the personal information of 350,000 Washington State residents was stolen in a January 2025 data breach.

The post Northwest Radiologists Data Breach Impacts 350,000 Washingtonians appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Several Vulnerabilities Patched in AI Code Editor Cursor
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Attackers could silently modify sensitive MCP files to trigger the execution of arbitrary code without requiring user approval.

The post Several Vulnerabilities Patched in AI Code Editor Cursor  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Gene Sequencing Giant Illumina Settles for $9.8M Over Product Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Illumina will pay $9.8 million to settle accusations that products provided to the US government were affected by cybersecurity flaws.

The post Gene Sequencing Giant Illumina Settles for $9.8M Over Product Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Gen Z in the Crosshairs: Cybercriminals Shift Focus to Young, Digital-Savvy Workers
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Should Gen Z to be treated as a separate attack surface within your company?

The post Gen Z in the Crosshairs: Cybercriminals Shift Focus to Young, Digital-Savvy Workers appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: In Other News: Microsoft Probes ToolShell Leak, Port Cybersecurity, Raspberry Pi ATM Hack
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: Microsoft investigates whether the ToolShell exploit was leaked via MAPP, two reports on port cybersecurity, physical backdoor used for ATM hacking attempt.

The post In Other News: Microsoft Probes ToolShell Leak, Port Cybersecurity, Raspberry Pi ATM Hack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Microsoft Boosts .NET Bounty Program Rewards to $40,000
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Valid, complete reports detailing remote code execution or elevation of privilege bugs in .NET qualify for the maximum rewards.

The post Microsoft Boosts .NET Bounty Program Rewards to $40,000 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Russian Cyberspies Target Foreign Embassies in Moscow via AitM Attacks: Microsoft
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Russian state-sponsored APT Secret Blizzard has used ISP-level AitM attacks to infect diplomatic devices with malware.

The post Russian Cyberspies Target Foreign Embassies in Moscow via AitM Attacks: Microsoft appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cyber Risk Management Firm Safe Raises $70 Million
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Safe has raised $70 million in Series C funding to advance cyber risk management through specialized AI agents.

The post Cyber Risk Management Firm Safe Raises $70 Million appeared first on SecurityWeek.
